intro: Kadsura philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine kadsura, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and unique, tubular flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests, thriving in humid tropical climates. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow with a strong, musky scent, which attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
